document.title: English Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools March 2024

99F1348EE79D457A82C359E1380FBC83.description:
In small or large group settings, informally share recorded information collected from
research.

3D3B270D7C2A4525BFFC7306FD498C83.description: Use drawing, writing, or dictation to record facts and information collected from research.

F7686A48AC774DE7B32C4BC7D8B594F3.description: Use templates to organize the information collected (e.g., charts, graphs).

43AEA3DC6C3E47E98DA7B7083FFBA211.description:
Locate and collect information related to the given topic from pictures, texts, people, or
provided sources.

D77E5307F2A94B68BA080238CBD1491C.description: With prompting and support, generate research questions related to a given topic.

362BAD14F3FF44A78A2A85F160CA5FEF.description:
The student will conduct research and listen to a series of conceptually related texts on
selected topics to build knowledge on grade-level topics or solve problems using available
resources.

D819D1EE12FA47BBBACDD2394821EFF6.description: **Standards related to Examining Media Messages are introduced in Grade Four.

0F08A922DB344D96A7A823EAB32FF623.description: **Standards related to Integrating Multimodal Literacies are introduced in Grade Two.

96B9BDE02EB44F44A8BC60D70FE1FAA5.description:
Retell, create, and dictate stories, rhymes, poems, and events in sequential order using
drama, props, and/or pictures indicating first, next, and last events in a story.

B2305FDC90A148329B9C0EE77CE2CDFD.description:
Participate in a variety of oral language activities, including choral speaking and recitation
of short poems, rhymes, songs, and stories with repeated patterns and refrains.

C855F19C851B44219B98E64BE2A38216.description: Speak audibly with appropriate pacing, prosody, and voice level.

8F00E5EFC2434DBCA336D418B8E93AD6.description:
Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details and using appropriate
vocabulary.

C6F1E5E9626D49D38F5CF66314D1DE96.description: Expressing ideas and needs in complete sentences.

70DCF3F9BA7C41D4BF8C7BAFCB5D9AB4.description:
Asking questions to seek help, get information, or clarify information for further
understanding.

AA9B4DDED4FA477AB98FFB5CEFBB4BF8.description: Respectfully building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

AC5A78D34EBB4702BD22AD0C4BEC5653.description:
Listening actively and following agreed-upon rules for participating in discussions
(e.g., waiting for a turn to speak without unnecessary interruptions and staying on
topic).

91A6D7020F904B21AF1BD4E14F9CEF68.description:
Participate in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led)
on grade one topics and texts. This includes:

978A0EE8F1B24CE581F0D31E1B0BF5D0.description:
The student will develop effective oral communication and collaboration skills to build a
community of learners that process, understand, and interpret content together.

373F6C523C814E7DB59E59751129C25E.description:
Use conventional spelling of words with commonly taught spelling patterns and for
frequently occurring irregular words.

2C96F41863EF419EBCC08FFEF7CC0734.description:
Identify statements and questions and, use correct ending punctuation (e.g., period,
questions mark, and exclamation points).

78356EEA76FD4E309AB508A08F64125A.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence, proper nouns, and the pronoun I.

F845DF4536F344E98F995B469704CE0C.description:
Use interrogatives to ask questions in complete sentences (e.g., who, what, where, when,
why, how).

DF1FE01AB8054466BD9EAFC668BD0A14.description: Use articles correctly (e.g., a, an, the).

6F3F1B6A4BCB4C5CAC23D51067ABC4FA.description: Use proper verb tense and correct subject-verb agreement.

E963D58623E54EC5BB1BC4C5B1480877.description: Form and use simple verb tenses (past, present, and future) for regular verbs.

32EF229A2F61406B9AC8BEF2767DFC54.description:
Use frequently occurring adjectives to describe specific objects (quantity, size, age, shape,
color, or location).

C2F09FB2FC234F0D8D79355820312C7B.description: Use personal and possessive pronouns to represent nouns.

84359C91321748C4A792E17C64DBBBC1.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding ‘s’ or ‘es’ sound.

1FF0CD7CFC8E4D4793BCFE35FF5F143E.description: Produce and expand simple sentences, including a noun, verb, and adjective.

AAFDA8739D87410890F28846B2F50986.description:
The student will use conventions of Standard English when speaking and writing,
differentiating between contexts that call for formal English and situations where informal
discourse is more appropriate.

12E71FD38C5242298410D19FDC61B0EC.description:
With guidance and support from adults, edit writing for conventions e.g., spelling,
capitalization, usage, punctuation). (See Language Usage for grade level expectations).

CF6987161936449BA5D909C493F92491.description:
Composing a series of simple sentences focused on the topic, including sentences with
a subject and predicate, subject/verb agreement, and one or more descriptive adjectives.

45DBFB0E39CD4787BD94349D3FCA73CE.description: Identifying the audience and purpose of the writing (e.g., letters, stories, journals, etc.).

A411EAF99F324495B65697B5DD81E185.description:
With guidance and support, use a variety of prewriting activities, such as brainstorming,
drawing and graphic organizers, to generate ideas and draft writing or dictation. This
includes:

9A4673905DB844F381E5BDCB41043CDB.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing about text(s) read or heard in which
students share their thinking with a couple of supporting details from the text.

DC7EA918441E442DBA9275E10E969B04.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces that state
an opinion and supply a reason for the opinion.

66731690D6B746D297958155561803BD.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/expository
texts that name a topic and supply some facts about the topic.

C4B5BC914E2A478B9EEEA186B6173889.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to recount two or more sequenced
events or experiences and include details about the events and characters.

AFD56C3B048A493480BB901A3129BB02.description:
The student will write in a variety of forms for diverse audiences and purposes linked to
grade one content and texts.

85419709A48F46C699839436FA21556A.description:
Use phoneme/grapheme (sound/symbol) correspondences to encode (spell) grade-level
high-frequency words with automaticity and accuracy.

010726B7EE7E4409B955F71813594F3C.description: Encode (spell) unfamiliar words by recognizing and applying taught word patterns.

0156C0DBB21946BABA7F0DE0539D1F0D.description:
Encode (spell) 2-syllable words (e.g., pancake) following basic patterns by breaking the
words into syllables.

C3FB1DBBDBBA4C4F8CF4589B3CC69759.description:
Use phoneme-grapheme (sound/symbol) correspondence to encode (spell) single-syllable
words containing closed syllables (cvc, ccvc, cvcc, and ccvcc), open syllables (cv, ccv),
vowel-consonant-e (cvce, ccvce).

093E0A93585B460CB3AC4C303B7651F7.description: Accurately and automatically apply spaces between written words in phrases or sentencelevel writing.

A05FC266C56B499997FD922F7267A32C.description:
Accurately and automatically form all capital and lowercase letters and numbers using
manuscript letter formation.

47BEE5F848B94FAB8DB18CC1B9BEAA52.description: Use functional pencil grasp for letter formation.

E4431F4D529545A7A1DAC2A7EAFCCBBE.description: The student will print legibly in manuscript.

84A0929C79FD4439A7E02665D9664B13.description:
Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in
a text.

3B442FDE420945AD929C27B30C813E71.description: Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic.

9B7BF9B32ED6442AAEBFF80973A5770F.description:
Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other illustrations and information
provided by the words in a text.

9E3E4FFB86C14F9F909DAF979717D019.description:
Identify and use common text features to gain information: table of contents, headings,
bolded words, and pictures, captions, and diagrams.

5DBF62AFC0844457A164D2E88B166891.description: Explain the difference between facts and opinions in a text.

33B53F817C334C40A1ECB10821BAC456.description: Identify the main idea and supporting details of a text.

605D1AB0A58C4337931E2F80F6C55D6B.description:
Ask and answer literal (who, what, when, where) and inferential (why, how) questions
about what is read, including demonstrating an understanding of the main topics.

3EDEAC3636E24AFB91FF141986147D98.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of informational texts heard or read.

95CFD924757D42949241BD08BB3475F7.description:
Compare and contrast the adventures or experiences of characters in stories heard, using
key details.

F4FC068FA4CF4401A19B0E93AE6D8062.description:
Make connections between characters, settings, and major events in stories heard, using
key details.

F7F723757DBD4DDBB3AAABA79A8A033D.description:
Set a purpose for reading by providing a guiding question, activating prior (experience) and
background (content) knowledge.

9700D607172F40308957F07D5434F79F.description: **Standards that address Craft and Style are introduced in Grade Three.

70857340AFCD414780DA0F164C3F5E05.description: Generate predictions about story characters and events using the text.

5E11C5801FD44BA2B283133FD55C98E6.description:
Ask and answer literal (who, what, when, where) or inferential (how, why) questions about
what is read.

DE593DE136F14064A172B35B1532D310.description:
Identify the elements of a familiar story, including the characters, setting, and important
events (e.g., conflict and resolution).

4687705D96704463B6AA94461448E067.description:
Retell familiar stories sequentially and demonstrate an understanding of the story structure,
the central message or lesson, and the details.

9E3B4861ED6740DD852EF7257F73F44C.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of literary texts heard or read including fantasy, humor,
fable/fairy tale, realistic fiction, historical fiction, and folklore/tall tale.

A46E209A18474646807366B1398DD612.description: Use newly learned words and phrases in discussions and speaking activities.

5F2AE158B1204EDAAD2A8754443A2534.description:
Increase and develop breadth of vocabulary knowledge by listening to high quality,
complex text.

D5832C5856D54702970400FAC8EA1C1D.description:
Identify the purpose of simple reference materials (e.g. picture dictionary, digital
dictionary).

FCA4EE8EB0504D31BD081BC05475ED58.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs and adjectives

97B0539CF9284786A1A5AEC1FF387830.description:
Determine the meaning of an unknown word using frequently occurring root words and
inflectional affixes (e.g. -s, -ing, -ed).

C45140B0E5A74ABDB8A5265F8BA10AA8.description: Ask for the meaning of unknown words and make connections to familiar words.

911E410B3A5448EAAFA386AFC99CED28.description:
Identify antonyms and synonyms of familiar words to deepen understanding of word
meaning and relationships.

D4637CCA06B742959326621273343FF2.description: Discuss meanings of words in context from a variety of texts.

E240C8D6DF874C6BBC27E468A85C28AA.description: The student will systematically build vocabulary and word knowledge based on gradeone content and texts heard or read.

53823812709F4ADEA00CE34CC614FE79.description:
Regularly engage in listening to a series of conceptually related texts organized around
topics of study to build knowledge and vocabulary. Use this background knowledge as
context for new learning (Deep Reading on Topics to Build Knowledge and
Vocabulary, K-12).

5B7443B2A35B464497993D41FF019D03.description:
With prompting and support, when responding to text through discussions and/or writing,
draw several pieces of evidence from read-alouds to support claims, conclusions, and
inferences, including quoting or paraphrasing from texts accurately and tracing where
relevant evidence is located (Textual Evidence, K-12).

613140D58E2343B286FE6218FF246DE5.description:
Use knowledge of letter-sound correspondences to read a variety of decodable and gradelevel texts with accuracy, automaticity, appropriate rate, and meaningful expression in
successive readings to support comprehension. Monitor while reading to confirm or selfcorrect word recognition and understanding, as necessary (Reading Fluency, K-12).

62CB3C2890304F5DBB328B668B65AFE6.description:
The student will build knowledge and comprehension skills from reading and
listening to a range of challenging, content-rich texts. This includes fluently reading
decodable texts and gathering evidence from reading widely (through content-rich read
alouds) on topics to gain purposeful knowledge and vocabulary.

B6C0919D6A7A4C2D97A570E7AF2904F7.description: Developing Skilled Readers and Building Reading Stamina

2D42E15844614FC0B7718F8D77E7FF25.description: Write grade-level high-frequency words with automaticity and accuracy.

1CCA0FEF58804F5388A55CE60BD34936.description:
Read grade-level high-frequency words, including decodable and irregular words with
automaticity and accuracy.

3A6C7767D4D44510B49A288A607F55EB.description: Decode multisyllabic words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables.

E9C5EE7C3234471C98BB4EC63AF401E5.description: Use letter-sound correspondences to decode words containing common vowel teams and rcontrolled vowels.

24FFB30E5311437185E10539B23DA87A.description: Decode and encode words with long vowels, open syllables, (CV, CCV) and vowelconsonant-e (CVCE, CCVCE).

D9B5A2F472884CE8977D2CFBE5DD9651.description:
Decode and encode words with short vowels to include blends with digraphs, closed
syllables (CVC, CCVC, CVCC, CCVCC).

A095E3233B6D4508A267947E9AB5F4B3.description:
Phonics and Word Analysis: The student will apply phonetic principles to read and
spell words.

B9ED6CDD81ED466DA037CF7B04F1100E.description:
Demonstrate the ability to segment words with four and five phonemes, including words
with consonant digraphs (e.g., th, sh, ch) and consonant blends e.g., fr, st, bl).

8CD93FC2D9BC417DACB6130A72EBB13F.description:
Demonstrate ability to blend words with four and five phonemes, including words with
consonant digraphs (e.g., th, sh, ch, wh) and consonant blends (e.g., fr, st, bl).

2682FA5199504011AF449E79A06C1F62.description: Isolate sounds in four and five phoneme words.

000D92EFC70F4021934699C1E0273FBE.description:
Phonological and Phonemic Awareness: The student will orally identify and
produce various phonemes (individual sounds) within words to develop phonemic awareness
in support of decoding (reading) and encoding (spelling).

F7B32B4D6838465D8AD067A8C3820BF7.description: See Kindergarten for standards that address Print Concepts.
